Topic.Title: The Arrogance of Mayer is Startling . . . No Communication

Message.Msg: I think what you take to be arrogance is in reality just solid business strategy! On the issue of how many shares were bought with the "685M" downpayment on a stock buyback...I think we already have the answer. YHOO reported in mid July the repurchase of 40 million shares of their stock. I believe this is the stock YHOO is now calling the downpayment on Ma's cash. YHOO did not have Ma's money then and they are careful to call the funds spent...a down payment. I suspect YHOO recouped the 685M back to their treasury and now hold the 3B for distribution, or have in fact bought more stock under the current 5B authorized buyback using Ma's money..

Message.Title: Strong buy recommend on Yahoo, one year target $25.
Message.Msg: Strong buy recommend on Yahoo, one year target $25. The reasons are as below: 1. Under estimated asset value. After selling all of its holdings on Alibaba and Yahoo Japan, Yahoo would own up to $18B - $20B cash! That's the same as its current market capital. In other word, Yahoo is currently selling at cash level ($16/share and $19B). 2. Under estimated core business. Yahoo core business is generating around $1.3B positive cash flow every year for the past three years and the market is evaluating it at negative value. Yahoo search patents could worth billions and made Yahoo a potential buyout target for MSFT, Apple or others. 3. Under estimated EPS and P/E With the cash from selling Alibaba and Yahoo Japan and its operation, Yahoo could do massive buyback to buy back up to 80% of its current floating shares at current price($16), if Yahoo's profit remains unchanged during the buyback, Yahoo EPS could rise from the current $1 to $5, Yahoo share price could easily go to $30 level or even much higher. AOL is an example for Yahoo, both company had received billons from selling assets or patents and both company have a new CEO from Google. The difference is, AOL only received $1.1B cash from selling patents and yet Yahoo could receive up to $18B - $20B cash from selling its assets and patents. AOL price has been doubled since it issued a one time special dividend after receiving $1.1B from selling patents to MSFT. 4. Under estimated board and management Third Point has now become the largest shareholder and taken control of the board and the company lately and introduced a lot of good changes to the company especially the new CEO from Google - Marissa Mayer. Facebook hired Sheryl Sandberg from Google ten years ago and she helped Facebook to increase its revenue by more than ten times!!! Sheryl Sandberg was the VP of Google and was in charge of 4000 Google engineers. Marissa Mayer was also the VP of Google and was in charge of 3000 Google engineers. Apparently the market has under estimated the new board and the new management.

Topic.Title: Pretty bad YHOO and MM! Can not even hold $16 once again. With news, etc and from these low...

Message.Msg: Aren't these stories from Hedge Funds amusing saying that they, the investors want Yahoo to spend the entire $3.6 billion on stock buybacks. They are traders, pump and dump artists, and nothing they say can be trusted. None of them have been long-term holders, they are the ones that buy it at $15.75 and sell it at $16. Thousands of underperforming stocks do buybacks and their stock goes no where. Cisco did it for years, buying back shares, but then handing out millions of free stock options to the executives and employees. After the stock went no where, John Chambers finally and reluctantly paid a dividend. Like Yahoo, they don't see the retail shareholder as important, it' all about themselves.

Topic.Title: Kara Swisher is a jerk and is losing her clout-she wrote last week in a week we would hear something on the 3 billion

Message.Msg: Well, Kara does the best she can as Yahoo's 3rd party PR and IR person. If it weren't for her, we'd hear nothing from the official Yahoos. Never have so many been paid so much for doing so little for their shareholders.

Topic.Title: NOW WE KNOW HOW THE SHAREHOLDERS FEEL ABOUT NO DIVIDEND

Message.Msg: Any shareholder-friendly approach would be good, in my opinion. The problem with stock buybacks is if management is not executing or is doing senseless acquisitions as Yahoo has done in the past, any value that the shareholders might have gotten via a buyback would be lost. At least with a dividend, you have the cash and it's not dependent on some blue-sky "increasing shareholder value" proposition.

Topic.Title: It seems earnings have beaten the past few quarters and it is hard to....

Message.Msg: You know what the market thinks of Yahoo. So it should be no surprise that when the market is expecting very bad earnings and Yahoo beats estimates by showing bad earnings it does little for the stock price. Constantly losing market share and being down in revenue by 25% since the depth of the depression does not inspire confidence. Were it not for the Microsoft deal Yahoo would be selling assets to pay wages. Yahoo is in need of change. Yahoo needs the best, the brightest and the most innovative people out there to bring about that change. And Yahoo is not very high on their list of desirable places to work. Maybe M. Mayer can change that. But it will take months if not years if it’s possible at all.

Message.Title: Want to know why Wall Street hates Yahoo?
Message.Msg: Yahoo does not need Wall Street. Yahoo has almost no debt and almost $2 billion in cash and short term investments. Wall Street has no leverage over Yahoo and can't tell them what to do. No wonder they hate them... all Wall Street can try to do is trash their stock and management in the captive, idiot press.
